div.head: Proposition 28
div.p: The encomienda and repartimiento are most evil. The devil could not invent any other pestilence to better destroy that entire world, consume and kill all the peoples therein and depopulate—as have been depopulated—such great and so populous kingdoms, than the repartimiento and encomiendas of these peoples. The Spaniards’ encomiendas were established as if they were to hand these peoples over to all the devils, or like flocks of livestock handed over to hungry wolves. This encomienda or repartimiento is the most cruel tyranny and most worthy of hell fire that could be imagined. Because of it, all the peoples of the Americas are impeded from receiving the Christian faith. The Spaniards control their every day and night as unhappy tyrant comenderos, in the mines and personal work and incredible tributes, and by making them load great burdens on their backs to carry a hundred or two hundred leagues, as if and worse than if they were beasts. These comenderos also persecute and expel all the priests who preach the Gospel, who give them knowledge of God. All this is to say nothing of the violences, continuous larceny and homicide. Because of these encomiendas and repartimiento, the Indians have suffered and still suffer continuous torments, robberies, injustices in their persons and their children, women and goods. By these encomiendas and repartimientos, in the past forty-six years — I write as an eyewitness — more than fifteen million souls, without faith and without sacraments, have perished. They have also depopulated more than three thousand leagues of land, and I say this as an eyewitness. And as long as the encomiendas should endure — I pray that God be the judge of what I say — the monarchs’ power will not be enough, even if they were present in person, to stop the death, end, and consumption of all the Indians. By the encomienda, a thousand worlds would be destroyed, without having any remedy.
